content.description: At the very back of the chimney, a few feet past Batman Can't Fly, start up the right side of a massive wedged rock and traverse all the way out left under the roof to a wild downward flaring exit. Clip gear plenty long. Top roping would be problematic, without leading it and protecting the second. Listed as 10+ in the 1997 Cottrell Guide.
content.location: Located at the far end of the second chimney over to the right of Dinkum. The route starts up a massive car sized chockstone.

content.description: Climb a few moves up the right side of the blocks at the bottom of Dinkum wall to get a ledge, then use the crack at the back to jam your way up and around the large formation on the right. Then an easy scramble to the top anchors. Lower down for more fun in the Areta Franklin chimney!
content.protection: Toprope anchors (2 bolts) accessible from the top of Buck's Bar Dome.
content.location: The lowest climb on the Dinkum wall, this ascends the uphill side of the Inside Passage (the gap between Dinkum Wall and Areta Franklin Buttress).

content.description:
The obvious flake at the left end of the Dinkum Wall. Start as far left as you like, and follow the big downward-pointing flake as it wanders right and up, using underclings supported by good feet. The step right to exit the flake may be the most technical move. Find your line to the anchor above.

From Wikipedia: "Planned obsolescence... in industrial design is a policy of planning or designing a product with a limited useful life..." When the flake goes, so will this route. Also, give a thump on the less obvious flake just below the anchors; erosion will have its way with these features before too long (geologically speaking).
content.protection:
TR from a pair of bolts above. We used a couple of 2" or 3" cams in the flake system as directionals to mitigate the consequence of a giant pendulum from the anchors.

The flake looks like it protects well for a trad leader, but when it runs out, there's little to protect you.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Dinkum Wall of Bucks Bar Dome.

content.description: Palm Beach climbs on the left side of the arete using small sidepulls, smears, and the arete.  Holds are few and a longer reach may help.  Just at the downclimb move to get to the other climbing areas, step onto the wall at its right edge to get started.  Climb up from there using whatever you can find.  There is an 11 start down around the corner but is dirty and grungy and didn't look very appealing.
content.protection: There is no protection on this route but can be top roped using the anchors for its left neighbor, Drastical. You can rap from the anchors as there are rings.
content.location: Palm Beach is on the right edge of the wall to the right of The Gap (right of Dinkum) and literally just above where you have to downclimb a move to get the other climbing areas including Great Flake, Great Chimney, Puff Passage, and Main Area.

content.description:
Steep slab with slopey hands and feet.  All the beta i can really give is 'balance well'.

Nightmare is located just left of the obvious finger crack, Dinkum (5.9) on the south face of Buck's Bar Dome.
content.protection: The only way to protect this nightmare is via toprope.  From the top of Buck's Bar Dome, employ the right-most anchors.

content.description: Crux is the mantel/pull onto the first knob.  Pretty cool and then some more nice moves to the ledge.
content.protection: top rope, but frequently free soloed.
content.location: Starts at the base of the chimney downhill and right of Dinkum Crack. Mantel/pull out onto the knobs on the face up and right. hence straight up to a ledge, then up to the top of the cliff.  Avoid any chimney movement. Two bolts are at the top for a top rope.

content.description: Lap Dancing follows the first set of slopey "knobs" to the right of Dinkum. Climb Dinkum to the prominent ledge 10 feet off the ground. Traverse onto the face and go straight up. Avoid traversing too far to the right, or you'll end up on Fox Trot (same grade).
content.protection: Top Rope from the Dinkum anchor.

content.description:
Knob Job starts with the knobs right of Drastical on the Palm Beach Buttress. Follow the knobs up, then exit left to the crack that is the top of Drastical. Variation leads straight up (no crack) and is 5.11.

Not often climbed and it can look a little dirty. A surprisingly fun and technical route for CRG.
content.protection: Toprope anchor (2 bolts) can be used be scrambling down from the top of the buttress.
content.location: Palm Beach Buttress in the lowest chunk of rock on the Dinkum Wall. A large buckeye tree shades the rock here.

content.description: Bit of a boulder problem in an overhanging alcove lead to a mantle and a top out on a tall spire. I can't remember what I did for anchor... probably a gear anchor somewhere. The finish lands you inside Boulder Gulch.
content.location: This is just right of Finger Eater. Both routes, according to the Cottrell guide are in the "Tree Cracks" subsection of the Main Area. The dead trees have since fallen however.

content.description: Tenuous feet support a strenuous crimping lieback to get off the ground to a secure finger lock.  Thereafter bad feet and thin hands / fingers for 12 feet until a lieback cleans things up, but the transition from jams to liebacking is insecure and arguably the crux.  Finishes on thoughtful friction moves.
content.location: The obvious slightly overhung crack just as you come out of the trees and around the corner at the bottom of Dinkum Gulley.   Shares the anchors with Drastical.

content.description: This traverse starts at the base of Dreamer, going up and left via thin crimping and smearing to a ledge (crux).  Mantel onto the ledge, then work left and slightly up to the flake of Planned Obsolescence.  Undercling the lower part of this flake to the ground.  Interesting and a challenge.  Usually a bit dirty, especially on the ledge, so a clean off beforehand is recommended.
content.location: Starts at the base of Dreamer and goes up and left.

content.description: Another slabby top rope on the south face of Buck's Bar Dome.  Dreamer ascends up to two visable side-pulls 10 and 20 feet up the face.  It is located one route left of Nightmare and about 20 feet left of the obvious finger crack 'Dinkum'.
content.protection: Shares the same top anchors as Nightmare.  From the top of Buck's Bar Dome, these are the right-most anchors.

content.description: Start along the left leaning crack at the base or (more interesting) some knobs to the right.  Work onto a nice little ledge at the base of the upper right leaning finger crack.  The crux is the start of this crack, proceeding up and around onto a low angle face.  A very fun climb.
content.protection: A two bolt anchor on top for top-roping that you have to scramble down to.  Can lead with some small-medium nuts or cams.  Frequently free soloed (the first ascent was cleaned free solo).
content.location: Drastical is down hill from the Dinkum cliff, on the last rock past the big cave/chimney, facing west.  Starts as a face with a little left leaning crack at the base above a sandy landing.  Above is a right leaning finger crack.

content.description: Dinkum is the quality finger crack on the south face of Buck's Bar Dome.  You can easily spot it as you take the path down towards the main area.  Begin by climbing a 14' flake then the finger fun begins!
content.protection: Pro to 1 inch.  You may also hang a top rope from the bolted anchors above dinkum.  Walk around to the left to get atop Buck's Bar Dome.  The anchors for Dinkum are second from the right when you're looking down.

content.description: Walk 20' into the second chimney right of Dinkum and look up. Batman Can't Fly goes up a slightly overhanging crack on your right side to a roof split by a squeeze chimney. After transitioning into the roof (crux) arm lock, work your way out through the roof with solid arm locks until it's wide enough to squeeze through on the far end. It is short, but very fun, and definitely a worthy climb.
content.location: Second chimney right of Dinkum. 20 feet in and on the right.

climbs.name: Amazing Chimney to Dinkum Low Traverse

content.description: Near horizontal traverse right off the trails and rock floors, from the downhill side inside Amazing Chimney, back up a near horizontal traverse to above and left of Dinkum's crack and flake system start, then back to the start if you like.
content.protection: None, mind the occasional spiky rock behind you in this area
content.location: If you start this easy workout in the Amazing Chimney, it's easy to find from the Upper Dinkum Wall.

content.description: Choose one of two 5.6s- follow a fantastic crack with good low angle feet on the arete, or go into the chimney for a real snuggle-fest. Facing uphill or downhill changes the feel of the chimney greatly and there are some VERY tight squeezes, but good ledges through most of the climb mean that there is slow but steady progress.
content.location: Climb up the chimney between Dinkum wall and Areta Franklin Buttress. This is uphill from the gap walkthrough. It doesn't always appear so, but you can walk through here to the Boulder Gulch.
